title: 1993 Wimbledon Championships – Men's singles
text:
<a href="Pete%20Sampras">Pete Sampras</a> defeated <a href="Jim%20Courier">Jim Courier</a> in the final, 7–6(7–3), 7–6(8–6), 3–6, 6–3 to win the Gentlemen's Singles tennis title at the 1993 Wimbledon Championships. This was the first of Sampras's eventual seven <a href="The%20Championships%2C%20Wimbledon">Wimbledon</a> titles, an all-time record shared with <a href="William%20Renshaw">William Renshaw</a> until <a href="2017%20Wimbledon%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Singles">2017</a> when <a href="Roger%20Federer">Roger Federer</a> won his eighth title.
<a href="Andre%20Agassi">Andre Agassi</a> was the defending champion, but lost in the quarterfinals to Sampras.
This was <a href="Ivan%20Lendl">Ivan Lendl</a>'s final Wimbledon appearance; he lost in the second round. He was a runner-up in two Wimbledon finals. This was the only <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28tennis%29%23Tournaments">major</a> he did not win in his career.
Seeds.
